name: test_e2e_with_logs[284_NOSQL_MONGO_002]
description:
## Attack Pattern Information

| Item | Value |
|------|-------|
| **Pattern ID** | `NOSQL_MONGO_002` |
| **Name** | MongoDB $regex bypass |
| **Category** | NOSQL_EXTENDED |
| **Subcategory** | mongodb |
| **Severity** | `HIGH` |

## Attack Details

- **Payload**: `{"username": {"$regex": "^admin"}}`
- **Encoded**: `%7B%22username%22%3A%20%7B%22%24regex%22%3A%20%22%5Eadmin%22%7D%7D`
- **Expected Detection**: Yes

## Test Execution Results

- **Status**: `PASSED`
- **Detection Count**: 1 / 1
- **Latency**: ~6000ms
- **Timestamp**: 03:14:42.000 UTC

## Detection Evidence

**Rule Name**: [NGINX Emerging Threat] MongoDB NoSQL injection test_id=NOSQL_MONGO_002-1767842082388-tdy8t7 pattern_id=NOSQL_MONGO_002 uri=/?q=%7B%22username%22%3A%20%7B%22%24regex%22%3A%20%22%5Eadmin%22%7D%7D client=127.0.0.1

**Falco Log Entry**:
```
03:14:42.000000000: Critical [NGINX Emerging Threat] MongoDB NoSQL injection test_id=NOSQL_MONGO_002-1767842082388-tdy8t7 pattern_id=NOSQL_MONGO_002 uri=/?q=%7B%22username%22%3A%20%7B%22%24regex%22%3A%20%22%5Eadmin%22%7D%7D client=127.0.0.1
```
